required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mechanisms of Metabolic and Hormone Action on Plaque Formation in Brain and Carotid Vessels in Prostate Adenocarcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Mechanisms of Metabolic and Hormone Action on Plaque Formation in Brain and Carotid Vessels in Men Undergoing Androgen Deprivation Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This trial studies the mechanisms of metabolic and hormone action on plaque formation in brain and carotid vessels in participants with prostate adenocarcinoma. Studying the biomarkers in the laboratory may help doctors know the impact of androgen deprivation on metabolic, brain and cardiovascular endpoints.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants undergo clinical evaluations over 12 months including physical exam and vital signs, waist to hip circumference, electrocardiograms, medical history and events, laboratory evaluations, imaging evaluations, cognitive function evaluations, gait assessment, and quality of life questionnaires.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in visual characterization of 18F-florbetapir (Amyvid) positron emission tomography (PET) scans results after Andorgen Deprivation Therapy
primary_outcome.description: Change From Baseline visual characterization scan results at 12 months

primary_outcome.measure: Change standardized uptake values of 18F-florbetapir (Amyvid) positron emission tomography (PET) scans results
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline standardized uptake values in select regions of interest at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive test results: Story recall
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Story Recall results at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive Test Results: Change in Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MOCA)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline MOCA score results at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive Test Results: Change in Clinical Dementia Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Clinical Dementia Rating Scale score at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive Test Results: Digit span
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Digit span results at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive Test Results: Letter number sequencing
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Letter number sequencing results at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive Test Results: Stroop Test Results
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Stroop Test Results at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive Test Results: Symbol Digit Modalities Test
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Symbol Digit Modalities Test score at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive Test Results: Visuo-Spatial Learning Test
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Visuo-Spatial Learning Test results at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive Test Results: Rey auditory verbal learning test (RVLT)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Rey auditory verbal learning test (RVLT) score at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory and immune markers: Change in CRP
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline CRP values at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory and immune markers: Change in IGFBP3
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline IGFBP3 at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory and immune markers: Change in IGFBP1
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline IGFBP1 at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory and immune markers: Change in IGF-1
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline IGF-1 at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory and immune markers: Change in IL-6
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline IL-6 at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Markers: Change in HgbA1C
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline HgbA1C at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Markers: Change in Estradiol
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Estradiol at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Markers: Change in Follicle Stimulating Hormone (FSH)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Change in Follicle Stimulating Hormone (FSH) at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Markers: Change in Leptin
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Leptin at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Markers: Change in Adiponectin
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline Adiponectin at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Markers: Change in homeostatic model assessment of insulin resistance (HOMA-IR)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in baseline HOMA-IR values at 12 months; Calculated based on fasting glucose and insulin test results.

arm_group.description: Participants undergo clinical evaluations over 12 months including physical exam and vital signs, waist to hip circumference, electrocardiograms, medical history and events, laboratory evaluations, imaging evaluations, cognitive function evaluations, gait assessment, and Quality-of-life assessment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Histologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate
- Non-castrate disease with a serum testosterone level >= 50 ng/dL (1.73 nmol/L) at baseline
- No evidence of distant metastatic disease on baseline computed tomography-chest, abdomen and pelvis (CT-CAP) and bone scans or undetectable/stable prostate specific antigen (PSA) for > 2 years from definitive therapy in control group
- Patients will be stratified by the presence of absence of pre-existing cardiovascular disease defined as at least one of the following:
- Prior myocardial infarction >= 30 days before enrollment
- Prior revascularization procedure >= 30 days before consent, including:
- Coronary artery stent placement or balloon angioplasty
- Coronary artery bypass graft surgery
- Stent placement or balloon angioplasty to a carotid, iliac, femoral, or popliteal artery
- Carotid endarterectomy surgery
- Vascular bypass surgery of the iliac, femoral, or popliteal artery
- Results from angiogram or CT angiogram of coronary, carotic, iliac, femoral, or popliteal arteries that documents at least one vascular stenosis >= 50% at any time point before enrollment
- Carotid ultrasound results that shows stenosis >= 50% at any time point before enrollment
- Ankle-brachial pressure index < 0.9 at any time point before enrollment
- Subjects on ADT Group only: Intent to initiate continuous androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) for at least 12 months
- Subjects on Control Group only: No intention to initiate androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) within the 13 months after enrollment
- Subjects on Control Group only: Undetectable PSA after radical prostatectomy or stable PSA after any form of radiation as defined by principal investigator or primary oncologist
Exclusion Criteria:
- No prior treatment with ADT at time of study entry. (Prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant ADT is allowed only if the last injection of a depot formulation wore off at least 12 months prior to enrollment)
- Previous or concurrent hormonal or systemic therapy for prostate cancer including: anti-androgens, estrogens, megestrol acetate, ketoconazole, abiraterone, enzalutamide, or chemotherapy. (Prior or planned neoadjuvant bicalutamide for prevention of tumor flare is allowed)
- Plans to start or continue treatment with an investigational product after enrollment
- Poorly controlled type 1 or type 2 diabetes mellitus, based on hemoglobin A1c, as judged by the investigator
- Prior or planned surgical castration
- Poorly controlled hypertension at time of study entry, as judged by the investigator
- Myocardial infarction or stroke < 30 days prior to enrollment
- Coronary, carotid, or peripheral artery revascularization < 30 days prior to enrollment
- Planned or scheduled cardiac surgery or percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) procedure that is known at the time of enrollment
- Mental incapacity or language barrier precluding adequate understanding or cooperation
- Inability to tolerate amyloid positron emission tomography (PET) imaging, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) imaging, Lupron, or Degarelix
- Any other clinically significant disorder which may affect the subject's health or the outcome of the trial as judged by the investigator
